subject: Web3
title: Tracking Food from Farm to Fork
description: A fast breakdown of Tracking Food from Farm to Fork for builders.

hook.text: When contaminated lettuce sickens hundreds, tracing the source takes weeks. Blockchain can do it in seconds.

buildup.text: Walmart partnered with IBM to track produce on a blockchain. Every step from farm to shelf is recorded.

discovery.text: Before blockchain, tracing a bag of mangoes took seven days. With it, the trace takes 2.2 seconds.

twist.text: The blockchain is only as good as the data entered. If someone lies at the source, the chain records the lie.

climax.text: Food traceability blockchains are expanding globally. Knowing where your food comes from is becoming a consumer right.

punchline.text: From seven days to two seconds. Blockchain made food traceable.

quiz.question: How did blockchain improve Walmart's produce tracing?
options: Reduced trace time from seven days to 2.2 seconds
